title: Stock Movers: Trade Desk, Sweetgreen, Heartflow
description: Bloomberg journalists discuss today's biggest winners and losers in the stock market. Listen for analysis on the companies making news on Wall Street.
content: On this episode of Stock Movers: - Trade Desk (TTD) analysts are bailing on the one-time market favorite amid growing fears that its advertising technology will get steamrolled by Amazon.com Inc.’s offerings. At least four firms downgraded the stock in the wake of its results and forecast, which crystallized concerns over its growth prospects in a future where Amazon is a more pronounced player. - Sweetgreen (SG) is lower after it slashed its sales guidance after a second straight quarter of disappointing results, highlighting the salad chain’s struggles to sell $15 salads to budget-strained diners. CEO Jonathan Neman said the quarter’s performance reflected macroeconomic challenges and subdued trends in the industry, particularly in several of the company’s biggest urban markets. Sweetgreen is also discontinuing its ripple fries, Neman said, citing the complexity the menu item added to kitchens - Heartflow (HTFL) shares surged 66% after the artificial intelligence software platform focused on heart disease raised $317 million in its initial public offering. Shares of the Mountain View, California-based company traded at $31.49 each on Friday as of 1:01 p.m. in New York, versus an IPO price of $19 apiece. The offering of 16.67 million shares by the company priced above range, after the stock was marketed for $17 to $18 each. The trading gives Heartflow a market value of about $2.6 billion based on the outstanding shares listed in its filings.
summary: Trade Desk (TTD) is down due to concerns that its advertising technology may be vulnerable to Amazon.com's offerings. Meanwhile, Sweetgreen (SG) is lower after cutting its sales guidance due to disappointing results and its struggles to sell $15 salads to budget-strained diners. Shares of Heartflow (HTFL), an artificial intelligence software platform focused on heart disease, rose 66% after the company raised $317 million in its initial public offering. Shares now trade at $31.49 each, a price change from the IPO price of $19 apiece. The IPO gave Heartflow a market value of about $2.6 billion.
shortSummary: Shares of Trade Desk, Sweetgreen, Heartflow, and others fell as analysts downgraded the company amid concerns about its growth prospects and competition from Amazon.com.
argos_summary: Trade Desk (TTD) faces downgrades from multiple analysts due to concerns over its growth prospects as Amazon's advertising technology gains prominence. Sweetgreen (SG) has lowered its sales guidance following two quarters of disappointing results, attributing its struggles to macroeconomic challenges and changing consumer behavior. In contrast, Heartflow (HTFL) saw a significant stock surge of 66% after raising $317 million in its IPO, with shares trading above the initial offering price, giving the company a market value of approximately $2.6 billion.
